channel.title: Web3 Security Paper Digest
channel.description: Curated papers on Web3, blockchain, and smart contract security from ArXiv and ACL

item.title: UEChecker: Detecting Unchecked External Call Vulnerabilities in DApps via Graph Analysis
item.description:
Summary

  • Introduces UEChecker, a deep-learning tool that detects unchecked external call vulnerabilities in smart contracts/DApps using call-graph analysis and a Graph Convolutional Network.
  • Key modules: edge prediction to reconstruct node/edge features, node aggregation to capture local structure, and a Conformer Block (multi-head attention + convolution + feedforward) to capture multi-scale dependencies beyond immediate neighbors.
  • Evaluated on 608 DApps, reporting 87.59% detection accuracy and outperforming baselines such as GAT, LSTM, and standard GCN.
  • Targets vulnerabilities that enable exploits like flash loan attacks and reentrancy by identifying external calls whose results are not validated.

Paper Type

  • Research

Additional Information

  • Authors: ['Dechao Kong', 'Xiaoqi Li', 'Wenkai Li']
  • Tags: ['smart-contract-security', 'vulnerability-detection', 'graph-neural-networks', 'static-analysis', 'DeFi']
